name: Amari Orchid Pattaya

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for a long weekend in the Amari and initially we had a couple of apparent dissapointments. Firstly our taxi pulled up outside the resort reception and everything looked pristine and wonderful - ideal we thought until the reception told us we were staying in the tower on the otherside of the complex. Anyway they drove us around there only to be told that our room wouldn't be ready for an hour. This is annoying from the fact that although it was 1.30 in the afternoon by this time we were on a package so it was no surprise as to what time we were arriving.
reviews.title: An Oasis in Pattaya

reviews.text: Next we asked about the internet. Yes they had WIFI in the rooms - great! Yes we would have to pay nearly 600BAHT per day to use - not so good. No - we could not use 2 computers off of one login - if both me and my wife wanted to use simultaneously we would have to pay twice - very bad......
reviews.title: one of the best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From there on in though things started to improve. The room was excellent with an open bathroom and double sink, large window overlooking the swimming pool and bay (the tower is actually on the seafront road). Smallish balcony (OK for 2 and to dry your swimming stuff though). Flatscreen TV with all the usual TV channels as in most international hotels. Desk, good size wardrobe and a safe box. So far so good.
reviews.title: Even management disappointed us after providing feedback

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From there we went down to the pool area. The gardens are superb and have a lovely ambience. Tehere are 2 pools and as we walked past the first it was a little too noisey for our liking as there were a number of out of control kids spoiling it for everyone. Fortunately we kept on walking to the longer "infinity" pool which is obviously more attuned to adulat with a spa bath at one end and the pool ideal for swimming lengths with no shallow end for the kiddies. A perfect way to while away the hours. If you are lucky enough to be an early riser you can also bag one of the poolside gazebos which also double up as a place for the spa staff to deliver massage. Wonderful.
reviews.title: Value for money

reviews.text: All told the hotel is kept to an excellent standard and is well managed with polite and attentive staff (even though they are still occasionally prone to the Thai trait of saying "yes" when they don't really understand you). On the basis of you get what you pay for then this hotel is excellent value for money and I would recommend it to any seeking a quiet haven in the otherwise loud hustle and bustle of Pattaya.
reviews.title: Wow beautiful new hotel with 5* deluxe quality

reviews.text: I have stayed here more than 4 times as its a wonderfull hotel with all the fecilities you want. The rooms are the best and rates are quite affordable. I was also upgraded to a executive suite room on the 12th floor during my 3rd stay with them and those rooms are wonderfull with pool view below and the sea view a bit away and one side of your room is mostly with only glass. The food is excellent and the buffet breakfast is one of the best you can have. Though its an business trip, i always had a weekend to spend at this hotel and its always been fun. The staff of the hotel are for sure like your frineds and the reciption desk take care of all your needs and help you at all times. Location of this hotel is good as its in the begining of the beach road and its around 15 mins walk along the beach road you will reach walkers street and along the beach walking any time of the day you will also have shops and supermarkets to buy anything you want. There is no pronblem of walking 24 hrs or taking a tuk tuk or a bike lift as pataya for that matter is live 24 hrs almost. Hotel staff also can arrange for you to go around or guide you accordingly.
reviews.title: Business trip to Pataya

reviews.text: Guys, i visited Amari in march...the interiors are good..the overall setup of the hotel is fine...the breakfast served was amazing and delicious.
reviews.title: Just Wonderful...

reviews.text: The swimming pool is awesome ...one suggestion try taking rooms in the newer side of the property; because there is a huge difference in the new and the old rooms. The beach is at walking distance ...nice surroundings...the beach view from the hotel balcony is amazing..
reviews.title: Ocean Tower the better choice

reviews.text: Good Experience....
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: We were fortunate enough to stay in the Ocean Tower this visit.
reviews.title: worst hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: advertised as a 4-5 star hotel, the amenities included in your price are only as good as 2 star hotels we have stayed at. no thai atmosphere, just like a modern office block, very clean and bland and no lift in the 4 storey garden building. the reception staff only speak limited english so any problems take a great deal of sorting and time. the only good things about this hotel are the bell boys, security and room cleaners who are excellent and very friendly whilst other staff were very aloof. did not use any of the hotels dining rooms or bars during our stay as we wanted to experience the thai atmosphere so we used outside restaurants and .other leisure facilities. after our excellent experience at a hotel in phuket last year we were really dissapointed with our hotel this year and would not recommend this to anyone wishing to indulge in the thai experience, you would be much better off in going to a smaller hotel locally of which there are many in pattaya of good quality. i would realistically as a regular traveller only give this hotel a 3 star rating and that is only due to its size and cleanliness
reviews.title: amari orchid

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is good, however the service of your hotel is strong weakness. For example, every single breakfast we had a problem with customer service. as soon as we finished our first round waitress took out our plates but left dirty cuttleries on the table. Also, the swimming pool has never been cleaned for the whole time of our staying. In addition, I did not like that the swimming pool has been closed after 7 pm (it is a tourist city). Secondly, if you have any special events (like a wedding) you have to inform your customers otherwise it was really inconvinient for us as swiming pool has been occupied and we actually paid for it. Finally, there are a lot of foriengers staying in your hotel and in my opinion your stuff has to speak at least a little bit of English (e.g. once we called to garden wing, we wanted to have a drink, we asked about the exact location of this bar and one of the workers hang up on me, it was really disappointed). However as I came to have a rest I was not really care about the service so for me it was clean rooms and not bad location
reviews.title: Not bad but could be better

reviews.text: The Hotel is very clean and the staff is Fantastic !. Highly Recommended.
reviews.title: Amari Business Trip

reviews.text: Bar and Restaurant where always on time and service was very good. Unfortunatelty I did not have time to use the pool however I will next time.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel
I'll come back next time.
reviews.text: SPA service was very good and because of late closing time, convinient for business travelers.
I recommend to improve the firendlyness at the reception desk and willingness to listen to customers!
reviews.title: Charmy Hotel in local Style well placed

reviews.text: Food in Hotel was excellent although ate rarely in the complex owing to the vast array of food nearby. Mantra was particularly good with a huge variety of Thai and international quisine, the breakfast buffet was also excellent. Found the staff courteous and professional. Upon arrival we were upgraded to the Tower, room was superb with partial view of Pataya bay. The pools were excellent, found myself poolside most days in a cosy shaded position next to the lap pool. The location is at the quiet end of Beach Road unlike the Marriott Hotel, a quick 10baht flip from the glitz and glamour of Walking Street, and just over the road from the beach. 5* Hotel at Travelodge prices, only drawback for me was that they have no loyalty card scheme.
reviews.title: Amari - Beach Road

reviews.text: It was my first time i had spent alone in a resort as i am only 22 and travelling with work but my family wanted me to have a treat and booked me into your resort on the way back from paris to Australia.
reviews.title: I had a wonderful stay and the service was perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am a professional, model, ballerina and actress so after a big work europe trip your day spa, amazingly fresh food and warm welcoming service was perfect.
reviews.title: A Perfect Weekend....

reviews.text: I enjoyed it so much and i will be looking to stay again in the future,
reviews.title: Great Location!

reviews.text: We spent a relaxing "birthday" weekend getaway at the Amari Orchid (we live in Bangkok so Pattaya was the 'closest' option). Overall we were very pleased with the hotel and the very helpful friendly staff. Our wonderful travel agent, Lenny from Expat Holidays Thailand (www.expatholidaysthailand.com) arranged an upgrade for us (as a birthday surprise) and we got an Executive Room on the 22 floor. It wasn't a beachfront view, but the view over the pool and up into the city was just as interesting.
reviews.title: Good location in Pattaya

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is very popular with large tour groups and the weekend we were there it was full to overflowing, especially at breakfast time. The restaurant staff worked hard keeping the buffet stocked, but be prepared to wait if you are there on a busy day! The food was okay, not great but we've had worse at other hotels.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.text: The swimming pool area is great – lots of sun lounges & umbrellas, although the pool-side service (drinks/food/towels) was slow and not well organised; but the swim up bar was well patronized!
reviews.title: Nice hotel but spoilt by hotel cashing in on massive endless rude indian wedding parties.

reviews.text: Spoil yourself with a relaxing treatment at the hotel's beautiful spa. The staff (and products) are amazing and very well priced in comparison to other hotels/5* star spa locations.
reviews.title: Would have loved to stay longer

reviews.text: As a holiday destination in itself, Pattaya leaves a lot to be desired. It's a bit sleazy and not overly family/child friendly; the beach (for want of a better word!) is not worth the effort (nor is the Bh30 price for a broken old sun lounge) unless you want to take a boat ride out to one of the islands for parasailing, jet-skiing, fishing etc.
reviews.title: NICE ROOMS THE REST NOT IMPRESSED

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Try to get a room at poolside , in the tower, as the new holiday inn next to the amari has just opened .
reviews.title: great hotel good location outside all the husle and bustle of pattaya

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dont understand why no free wifi in the rooms avble in a 5 star hotel.
reviews.title: Would return to this hotel

reviews.text: Seaview Tower room is of remarkable value at the discount rate
reviews.title: Excellent Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 2 nights in a duplex club room.
reviews.title: one of the best hotel in the pattaya

reviews.text: Checkin was excellent - done in the club lounge. Offered a free room upgrade.
reviews.title: the best hotel that I have choose in pattaya

reviews.text: the hotel has an excellent location right on the beach on the far end from walking street....the hotel has 2 wings--the garden wing and the ocean tower...we ended up staying in the Garden Wing which is the older of the two!! the garden wing has 3 floors without a lift so not really suggested for families with kids....the breakfast was quite decent....overall a decent experience while minus the cold and uncourteous service from the staff!
reviews.title: decent location with cold service

reviews.text: This hotel (Amari Tower) is a very nice hotel.I had a wonderfull time. The breakfast buffet is good. The rooms are modern and clean. And the staff are well trained in kindness. WIFI is free only in the lobby and there were a lot of mosquitos ( in the lobby). For this reason my overall rating is good and NOT excellent.
reviews.title: Very kind staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 7 years travelling to Thailand at least once a year if not more.......Always stay at the Amari properties or ones they partner with....
reviews.title: Garden View Vs Ocean Tower

reviews.text: Stayed again this year at Amari Orchid...July 2012...my husband did not like the idea of an open plan loo so we ended up staying at the garden wing again..but i did take a tour of the ocean tower..so i am doing a comparison.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Garden View:
reviews.title: ocean tower a must

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were in room 710 which were considered Ocean Deluxe for 6 nights on a package that came with credits for room service. We are repeat guests and were disappointed.
reviews.title: Good, comfortable rooms but.......
Very good alternative in "entertaining" Pattaya
reviews.text: Rooms are internally good 5 star standards but not the standard of the big chains, large seperate bath and showers and a wonderful size. Would have rated 4-5 stars based on this alone. ALL service staff were excellent. Breakfast was acceptable. Room service quality, cost and portions was bad i.e value for money. We ordered a Thai papaya salad and said medium spicy, no shrimps as we had an allergy issue with crustaceans. It came with shrimps and yes, they replaced it and comp some drinks. Great service recovery efforts except it came with 12 supper hot chilli peppers(yes we counted). Unedible and it left us wondering if someone was unhappy with the initial rejection of the shrimps. We asked most Thais and they would be considered spicy for them. We showed the dish with chillis to F & B and once again gretat service recovery, they cancelled the entire bill for the meal which pleasantly surprised us. Forget the Essence Cafe except for breakfast as the ambience is really bad for dinner. Why? We visited it 2 nights- once it was completely empty and the next 1 table with a couple. If you really like dining alone in a huge area with empty tables and chairs - it would be perfect. We also dined at the Tavern Pub as we wanted to catch Wimbledon- acceptable standard- edible not WOW, pricey for the portions. What we were impressed with was that when we requested for the commentary to be turned up, they actually did and turned off the music at the bar. Servcie was impecable!

We played golf one day and returned to hotel to find NO HOT WATER and only found out when I was in the shower!! I called front desk who informed me there will be no hot water and it will be back in about 1 hour. I jumped in for a quick cold as I could no stand sitting around sweaty. My husband waited and 1 hr later we got a call from front desk informing us that the hot water will not be available and water supply will be completely off and when we turn it back on we may have yellow/brown water for a while. WOW! Credits for their bravery to call us as I do not envy her job then! After that episode we did not hear any mention from the hotel, no apology- NADA. It was like it never happened. Also,forget paying premium for Ocean Deluxe rooms, our room had a pool view, standing in the middle of the windows assuming it was centre of clock, we got an ocean view between 9-10 sections of a clock which meant nothing unless you stand at windows as the curtains hid the ocean. Felt kind of ripped off as that was the only difference between a standard and ocean deluxe room
reviews.title: great view with great food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Another important note, if you are getting away on an initial "get to know you" type getaway, this is not the room for you as there is absolutely no privacy in showers, bathtub and worse still the loo. Glass enclosed throne that has an opening at the top which would pose a challenge to sensitive noses and ears:) Lovely to look at but not too practical. Lavishing sexy in a tub or walking out of shower into the open may work but the other loo section???? My husband and I have been together for awhile and we were still very conscious of the lack of privacy on the throne:)
reviews.title: Excellent value
No Elevators...
reviews.text: We stayed at the Ocean Tower. Wonderful hotel. Service at the level of Mandarim Oriental. Attention to details, spectacular room with great ocean view. Facilities at the hotel are top notch, pool, gym, spa. Substantial and delicious breakfast.

description: Amari Orchid Pattaya offers the perfect setting for an idyllic seaside escape as well as a gateway to all the best that Pattaya has to offer. Just a relaxing stroll to the beach, the Ocean Tower soars 20 stories into the sky, offering contemporary rooms and suites with stunning views of glittering Pattaya Bay. The Ocean Tower envelops you in a picturesque oceanfront panorama with 297 spacious guest rooms. Walk through the surrounding landscaped gardens housing two swimming pools and arrive at the resort-style Garden Wing. The low-rise, semi-open-air style of the Garden Wing figures prominently in the design of the 228 guest rooms and suites. The Garden Wing nestles you in the peaceful surrounds of the hotel’s tropical gardens for supreme relaxation, where a back drop of lush tropical green surrounds you at every turn.
